2:

Text: Oliver Cromwell's head:  His legacy passed to his son Richard, who was overthrown by the army in 1659, after which monarchy was re-established and King Charles II, who was living in exile, was recalled.
Triplets:<Oliver Cromwell
3:
--------------------
<Text: Oliver Cromwell's head:  Charles' new parliament ordered the disinterment of Cromwell's body from Westminster Abbey and the disinterment of other regicides John Bradshaw and Henry Ireton, for a posthumous execution at Tyburn.>
Triplets:<Oliver Cromwell's head
4:
--------------------
Text: Oliver Cromwell's head:  After hanging "from morning till four in the afternoon", the bodies were cut down and the heads placed on a 20 foot spike above Westminster Hall (the location of the trial of Charles I).
